Nim0 parser in Nim

The scanner.

Read each ossLine of the source file character by character, detecting keywords of the language and other syntactic items: numbers, comments, identifiers...

Types

DebugInfo = object
  pc*: int                   ## Address in generated code
  row*: int                  ## Line number in source code
  line*: string              ## Line of source code
Source code information

Vars

ossVal: int32
The value when scanning an integer 
ossId: string
The name of the current symbol 
ossIndent: int
The current indentation level 
ossError: bool = true
Have we encountered errors? 
ossDebug: array[999 + 1, DebugInfo]
Source debug information for verbose mode.

Consts

ossNull = 0'i32
ossTimes = 1'i32
ossXor = 2'i32
ossDiv = 3'i32
ossMod = 4'i32
ossAnd = 5'i32
ossPlus = 6'i32
ossMinus = 7'i32
ossOr = 8'i32
ossEql = 9'i32
ossNeq = 10'i32
ossLss = 11'i32
ossLeq = 12'i32
ossGtr = 13'i32
ossGeq = 14'i32
ossRange = 16'i32
ossRangeL = 17'i32
ossPeriod = 18'i32
ossChar = 20'i32
ossInt = 21'i32
ossFalse = 23'i32
ossTrue = 24'i32
ossNot = 27'i32
ossLparen = 28'i32
ossLbrak = 29'i32
ossIdent = 31'i32
ossIf = 32'i32
ossIn = 33'i32
ossWhile = 34'i32
ossRepeat = 35'i32
ossFor = 36'i32
ossComma = 40'i32
ossColon = 41'i32
ossBecomes = 42'i32
ossLet = 43'i32
ossRparen = 44'i32
ossRbrak = 45'i32
ossThen = 47'i32
ossOf = 48'i32
ossDo = 49'i32
ossSemicolon = 52'i32
ossEnd = 53'i32
ossElse = 55'i32
ossElif = 56'i32
ossUntil = 57'i32
ossArray = 60'i32
ossObject = 61'i32
ossConst = 63'i32
ossType = 64'i32
ossVar = 65'i32
ossProcedure = 66'i32
ossBegin = 67'i32
ossModule = 69'i32
ossDollar = 90'i32
ossBang = 91'i32
ossPercent = 92'i32
ossEof = 100'i32

Procs

proc ossMark(msg: string) {....raises: [IOError], tags: [WriteIOEffect].}
Print the error message msg with location information in source file. 
proc ossSetDebugPc(pc: int32) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Save the program counter (PC) corresponding to a source ossLine, if not already saved. Else set the sentinel. 
proc ossIndentPop() {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Pop the top indentation from the stack of levels 
proc ossIndentSup(msg: string = "") {....raises: [IOError], tags: [WriteIOEffect].}
Check that the current indentation level is higher than the top of the stack of levels, else prints the error message msg. 
proc ossIndentEqual(msg: string) {....raises: [IOError], tags: [WriteIOEffect].}
Check that the current indentation level is the same than the top of the stack of levels, else prints an error message. 
proc ossIndentEqual(): bool {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Check that the current identation level is the same than the top of the stack of levels, returning the result instead of printing an error message. 
proc ossGet(sym: var int32) {....raises: [IOError, EOFError],
                              tags: [WriteIOEffect, ReadIOEffect].}
Get a new symbol from source code scanning. Its entry in the keywords table is returned into ossSym. 
proc ossInit(f: File; pos: int; o: File) {....raises: [IOError, EOFError],
    tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Initialize scanner module global variables.

Templates

template until(cond, body: untyped): untyped
Reproduces the repeat ... until condition loop that exists in Oberon.

Made with Nim. Generated: 2021-04-23 00:35:00 UTC
